item.title: Why Packaging Design Must Work Without Images in 2026
item.content:encoded:
Feb 6, 2026

Why Packaging Design Must Work Without Images in 2026

Packaging design must work without images in 2026 because most brand discovery now happens in small formats where photography becomes unreadable. Thumbnails, feeds and search previews compress visuals so heavily that type-first, abstract and high-contrast layouts deliver better recognition, clarity and recall than photo-dependent packs.

item.title: Flat vs Dimensional Packaging Design in 2026: Performance, Visibility, and What Works Best for Shelf and Digital
item.content:encoded:
Feb 4, 2026

Flat vs Dimensional Packaging Design in 2026: Performance, Visibility, and What Works Best for Shelf and Digital

Flat and dimensional packaging represent two core visual strategies used to communicate brand meaning across shelf and screen. Flat design relies on simplified forms and strong contrast, making it highly effective in fast-scroll digital environments. Dimensional design uses shadows, depth cues and hierarchy to attract attention in physical retail. In 2026, the most successful packaging systems blend these approaches using flat structures for recognition and designed depth to create focus, visibility and cross-channel consistency.

item.content:encoded:
Jan 26, 2026

A research-driven analysis of how Gen Z influences packaging design in 2026. This article separates real behavioral impact from hype, compares Gen Z with Millennials, Gen X and Boomers, and explains how brands can design packaging that performs across generations while meeting new expectations for clarity, transparency and value.

item.title: Typography-Led Packaging: Why Letters Are Becoming the Primary Brand Signal in 2026
item.content:encoded:
Jan 14, 2026

Typography-Led Packaging: Why Letters Are Becoming the Primary Brand Signal in 2026

Typography-led packaging is a 2026 design shift where letterforms replace logos and graphics as the primary brand signal. This article explores why typography outperforms imagery in human cognition, shelf recognition, and cross-channel consistency and how type becomes the brand itself.

item.title: What Is Human Packaging Design? Why Texture, Illustration, and Imperfection Matter in 2026
item.content:encoded:
Jan 13, 2026

What Is Human Packaging Design? Why Texture, Illustration, and Imperfection Matter in 2026

Human packaging design is a strategic response to AI-driven visual sameness. This article explains why texture, illustration, and intentional imperfection become commercial trust and recognition signals in 2026 helping brands stand out on shelf and in digital environments.

item.title: Proof-First Packaging Claims: How Brands Communicate Sustainability Without Greenwashing
item.content:encoded:
Jan 9, 2026

Proof-First Packaging Claims: How Brands Communicate Sustainability Without Greenwashing

In 2026, sustainability communication shifts from broad promises to proof-first packaging claims. Brands reduce claims, focus on verifiable improvements, and position sustainability as performance and economic intelligence rather than moral signaling.

item.title: What Is Connected Packaging? How QR and 2D Codes Turn Packaging into a Marketing Channel
item.content:encoded:
Jan 5, 2026

What Is Connected Packaging? How QR and 2D Codes Turn Packaging into a Marketing Channel

Connected packaging uses QR and 2D codes to link physical products with digital experiences. As the shift from 1D barcodes to 2D codes accelerates ahead of Sunrise 2027, packaging becomes an interactive, measurable, and owned marketing channel that extends beyond the shelf and into everyday use.

item.title: What Is Recyclable-by-Design Packaging? The 2026 Shift Toward Simpler Packaging
item.content:encoded:
Jan 2, 2026

What Is Recyclable-by-Design Packaging? The 2026 Shift Toward Simpler Packaging

Recyclable-by-design packaging is the new baseline in 2026. Learn why simpler packaging builds trust, reduces friction, and how brands can simplify structures and visuals without sacrificing shelf visibility or brand nuance.

Touch, Motion, Light: The Role of Sensory Interaction in Modern Packaging

Sensory packaging is packaging designed to engage one or more human senses such as sight, touch, sound, or scent beyond standard visual graphics. By adding interactive or tactile elements, it creates a memorable and emotionally engaging product experience that captures attention and increases perceived value.

What Is Premium Packaging and How Light Is Redefining It

Premium packaging is high-quality, design-driven packaging that enhances a product’s perceived value through exceptional materials, craftsmanship, and sensory storytelling. It goes beyond protection—creating an emotional connection through texture, structure, and reveal. Premium packaging expresses brand identity, quality, and exclusivity from the very first touch.

item.title: OLED Fashion: What It Is, How It Feels, and Why Wearing Light Changes the Way We’re Seen
item.content:encoded:
Sep 15, 2025

OLED Fashion: What It Is, How It Feels, and Why Wearing Light Changes the Way We’re Seen

OLED fashion is clothing and accessories that integrate organic light-emitting diode panels. Unlike point-like LEDs, OLEDs are ultra-thin, flexible, and printable area lights, so garments can glow softly, show logos or animations, and switch modes for day-to-night visibility, artistic expression, and interactive storytelling.

item.title: What Is OLED? Definition, Technology & the Future of Printed OLEDs (2025 Guide)
item.content:encoded:
Aug 29, 2025

What Is OLED? Definition, Technology & the Future of Printed OLEDs (2025 Guide)

OLED (Organic Light-Emitting Diode) is a thin, energy-efficient light source made of organic semiconductor layers that emit light when electricity passes through. Unlike LEDs, OLEDs need no backlight, enabling ultra-thin, flexible, and printable surfaces used in smartphones, TVs, wearables, safety gear, medical devices, and smart packaging.

item.title: High Visibility Wearables: Protecting Kids, Runners, and Everyday Commuters with OLED Technology
item.content:encoded:
Aug 22, 2025

High Visibility Wearables: Protecting Kids, Runners, and Everyday Commuters with OLED Technology

High visibility wearables are clothing and accessories that make people more visible in low light. They use reflective strips, LEDs, or OLED panels to actively emit light. This improves safety for workers, runners, cyclists, and children, reducing accident risks on roads and in dark environments.

item.title: How to Use Interactive Labels with OLED Technology in Marketing Campaigns Effectively
item.content:encoded:
Mar 21, 2024

How to Use Interactive Labels with OLED Technology in Marketing Campaigns Effectively

Light is all about visibility and the structure that follows it. Despite living in a digital, data driven world, we still seem to live in the dark, when it comes down to creating a successful marketing or branding campaign. In the dynamic and ever-changing world of marketing, customers are inundated with various types of content—primarily on social media, television, and even in real life—the challenge lies in crafting a successful and attention-grabbing marketing campaign, in a world that has seen it all on TikTok. In the past, we have been working with the world’s best brands and their marketing geniuses, that all utilized our technology to create captivating events and strategically position products in new channels. Reviewing these campaigns today we can see a clear structure on what is successful and not. Today, we want to share this knowledge with you on how to make run a successful in the new era of digitization and Gen-Z coming into the market. In this article, we will analyze the successful marketing campaigns mentioned earlier. We’ll examine the factors that contributed to their success and explore areas where improvements could have been made. Let’s delve deeper into this topic.

What it takes to make Smart Packaging become reality

For 30 years, smart packaging has been an idea that has failed to achieve larger market adoption and has generally been underwhelming despite various companies' attempts. Inuru's latest generation of luminous labels have been launched with CATTIER's brand reboot for Glamour, impressing even one of the oldest Champagne houses in the world. Our labels have all the necessary characteristics for market-ready solutions, and we discuss our key deliverables for smart packaging.

OLEDCON 2025: INURU Launches First Global Developer Conference for OLED in Everyday Products

INURU announces OLEDCON 2025, the first global developer conference focused on OLED technology in packaging, clothing, and everyday products. Held on June 24th at NIO House in Berlin and supported by Berlin Partner, the event will feature a world premiere of INURU's printed display, visionary talks from global leaders in design and innovation, and hands-on OLED design workshops.

item.title: First World OLED Developers Conference Announced
item.content:encoded:
May 20, 2025

First World OLED Developers Conference Announced

Inuru is organizing its first-ever World OLED Developers Conference, bringing together designers, engineers, and creators to explore recent advancements in OLED technology. The event will highlight Inuru’s novel OLED manufacturing method, enabling cost-effective production of OLED lighting and displays in any shape or color. It also focuses on integrating OLEDs into various products, including packaging, textiles, and automotive parts. Attendees will participate in workshops, view demonstrations, and engage in shaping the roadmap from OLED illumination to complex display systems.

item.title: We print displays-Inuru Prints Active Matrix OLED Display
item.content:encoded:
May 6, 2025

We print displays-Inuru Prints Active Matrix OLED Display

Inuru, a leading European OLED display manufacturer, has achieved a major breakthrough by successfully printing OLED displays in three separate colors using its current-generation technology. Based in Berlin/Wildau, Germany, Inuru has confirmed its compatibility with active matrix backplanes—the standard for modern high-resolution screens—paving the way for affordable, flexible displays in packaging, wearables, and smart appliances. This milestone positions Inuru among the most innovative display manufacturers in Europe, offering printed OLED solutions beyond traditional TV and smartphone applications.
